definition: first prize in a lottery
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
(bright) color/variety/applause/applaud/lottery prize

sentences.english: After winning the lottery jackpot, he went from rags to riches overnight.
sentences.chinese: 赢了乐透头彩后，他一夕之间从一贫如洗变成富翁。

sentences.english: What about those lucky few who do win a lottery jackpot?
sentences.chinese: 那些少数幸运赢得彩票头彩奖金的人呢？

sentences.english: The jackpot can be yours if you pick the six winning numbers.
sentences.chinese: 要是你挑中了六个幸运号码，头彩就是你的了。

sentences.english: His life is even poorer than before he won the lottery.
sentences.chinese: 他的生活甚至比中头彩之前还要贫困。

sentences.english: Want to experience the roulette game encounters the first prize?
sentences.chinese: 想要体验头彩冤家中的轮盘游戏吗？

sentences.english: That's why it feels like such a jackpot.
sentences.chinese: 这也是最吸引人的地方，那感觉就像中了头彩一样。

definition: to win a lottery
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
prize/award
to have a lucky stroke/to try one's luck
good omen/good luck (in business etc)/profits (gained in gambling, lottery etc)
two simultaneous happy events in the family
joy from heaven (idiom); overjoyed at unexpected good news/unlooked-for happy event
to win (a prize in a lottery)
to have good luck/lucky/in luck
to show appreciation for sb/to look upon sb with favor
winner/lucky guy/person who always gets good breaks
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
consolation prize/booby prize
to seize/to win
luck (in gambling)
to amaze the world with a single brilliant feat (idiom); an overnight celebrity
